column4: After upgrading to a larger monitor, my screen resolution is no longer auto detected... I am forced to manually set it bootup... any ideas?
each bootup
what video card?
nvidia 7300 le
run: gksudo nvidia-settings
ya, Ive done that... it says it saves to the config file....... but it doesn't work
not sine i apt-built it ;)
but yes the standard is dog slow, try opera if you want fast
apt-built? explain
opera is java based?
no, its coded in C and C++ (and I think some assembly)
its like emerge for gentoo, it uses deb-src and compiles source to make deb files which can make apps run nicer)
the apps run faster because they were compiled on your own machine?
it can help, give it a try. its a good laugh
sudo apt-get install apt-build; sudo apt-build update; sudo apt-build install firefox-3.0
have you used Firefox in Windows XP? its much faster than it is in linux.... at least in my installation
its all confiog my friend
read some guides, th commands i gave you will give you what you already have but you can set optomisation levels higher to see if its better
personally i think firefox is too fat, swiftfox is much nicer
dont be firefox brainwashed, there are lots of browsers out there
i've tried epiphany and midori... neither seem to produce 'accurate' looking web pages
apt-cache search web | grep -i browser
its from googlecode?? weird
thanks guy!!!
